title: Marvellous microbes, memory and the multiverse: Books in brief
summary:
Nature, Published online: 23 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00241-4

Andrew Robinson reviews five of the best science picks.
body: Nature, Published online: 23 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00241-4 Andrew Robinson reviews five of the best science picks.

title: 5,500-year-old human skeleton discovered in Colombia holds the oldest evidence yet that syphilis came from the Americas
summary: An ancient DNA analysis of a 5,500-year-old human skeleton reveals that an ancestor of the bacterium that causes syphilis was present in the Americas at least 3,000 years earlier than previously thought.

title: Californians have been using far less water than suppliers estimated — what does this mean for the state?
summary: Flawed assumptions about water demand mean suppliers in California overestimated future demand by an average of 74% over 20 years — positive news for the drought-embattled state.

title: The US Is In For Another Bad Year of Measles Cases
summary: A growing measles outbreak in South Carolina has infected more than 600 people since October, with hundreds more being potentially exposed.

title: Scientists may be approaching a 'fundamental breakthrough in cosmology and particle physics' — if dark matter and 'ghost particles' can interact
summary: Astronomers found evidence that dark matter and neutrinos may interact, hinting at a "fundamental breakthrough" that challenges our understanding of how the universe evolved.

title: ‘Bodies like ours aren’t considered in academia’
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00153-3

Two researchers describe how body size and having a disability can challenge perceptions of what a scientist should look like.
body: Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00153-3 Two researchers describe how body size and having a disability can challenge perceptions of what a scientist should look like.

title: Have environmental microplastics levels been overestimated?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00184-w

Microplastics are everywhere, but new research points to a need to standardize measurements of microparticles.
body: Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00184-w Microplastics are everywhere, but new research points to a need to standardize measurements of microparticles.

title: NIH ends support for some human fetal-tissue research – dismaying scientists
summary:
Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00251-2

The US biomedical funding agency also hints at future restrictions on research involving human embryonic stem cells.
body: Nature, Published online: 22 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00251-2 The US biomedical funding agency also hints at future restrictions on research involving human embryonic stem cells.

title: 2,400-year-old Hercules shrine and elite tombs discovered outside ancient Rome's walls
summary: Archaeologists have unearthed tombs and a shrine dedicated to Hercules from the time of the Roman Republic.

title: Coyote scrambles onto Alcatraz Island after perilous, never-before-seen swim
summary: Experts have reacted to a viral video of a coyote swimming to Alcatraz Island in what is a surprising first for the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: Stunning time-lapse video captured using 'artificial eclipse' shows 3 massive eruptions on the sun
summary: ESA's Proba-3 mission, made up of twin spacecraft capable of aligning to create artificial eclipses, has captured "rare" footage of three solar prominences erupting from the sun's mysteriously hot atmosphere.

title: Enormous freshwater reservoir discovered off the East Coast may be 20,000 years old and big enough to supply NYC for 800 years
summary: An expedition off the coast of Massachusetts has confirmed the existence of a freshwater reservoir beneath the seafloor. Now, scientists are starting to understand when and how it formed.

title: World's oldest known rock art predates modern humans' entrance into Europe — and it was found in an Indonesian cave
summary: The hand stencil is more than 1,000 years older than the previous earliest evidence of rock art.

title: 2.6 million-year-old jaw from extinct 'Nutcracker Man' is found where we didn't expect it
summary: A fossil jaw of a distant human relative was discovered much farther north than previously thought possible, revealing new information about diversity in human evolution.

title: The biggest ‘Schrödinger’s cat’ yet — physicists put 7,000 atoms in superposition
summary:
Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00227-2

Quantum superposition gets supersized — plus, US science after a year of Trump.
body: Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00227-2 Quantum superposition gets supersized — plus, US science after a year of Trump.

title: Untangling the connection between dopamine and ADHD
summary:
Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00094-x

Dopamine signals have long been a target for ADHD treatments. Now, researchers are learning how the neurotransmitter influences the condition.
body: Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00094-x Dopamine signals have long been a target for ADHD treatments. Now, researchers are learning how the neurotransmitter influences the condition.

title: More than half of authors of leading research say funding is declining
summary:
Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00054-5

Nature Index ‘Research Leaders’ survey also finds that scientists in North America and Europe are much more likely to say they intend to leave research.
body: Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00054-5 Nature Index ‘Research Leaders’ survey also finds that scientists in North America and Europe are much more likely to say they intend to leave research.

title: Girls are starting puberty younger — why, and what are the risks?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00089-8

More girls are hitting puberty at eight or earlier. Researchers are exploring the causes, the consequences and what should be done.
body: Nature, Published online: 21 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00089-8 More girls are hitting puberty at eight or earlier. Researchers are exploring the causes, the consequences and what should be done.

title: Earth hit by biggest 'solar radiation storm' in 23 years, triggering Northern Lights as far as Southern California
summary: Earth's magnetic field was struck by a "severe" solar storm Monday (Jan. 19), triggering vibrant auroras in the U.S. and large parts of Europe. The storm broke a record that had stood for more than two decades.

title: Giant underwater plumes triggered by 7-story waves at Nazaré captured off Portuguese coast — Earth from space
summary: A 2020 satellite photo shows the immense power of 7-story waves crashing along the Portuguese coast. Later the same day, a surfer rode a 101-foot-tall wave at Nazaré, setting a new world record.

title: How much protein do you actually need?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 20 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00151-5

Super-high protein diets are promoted by influencers, but the science shows that there are limits to how much your body can use.
body: Nature, Published online: 20 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00151-5 Super-high protein diets are promoted by influencers, but the science shows that there are limits to how much your body can use.

title: Ever watched a pet cow pick up a broom and scratch herself with it? You have now
summary: A pet cow in Austria started using a broom to scratch herself — the first ever documented case of bovine tool use.

title: Eerie 'sand burials' of elite Anglo-Saxons and their 'sacrificed' horse discovered near UK nuclear power plant
summary: The 1,400 year-old "sand burials" of two people and a horse were found near a nuclear power plant construction site in the U.K.

title: Last year, the oceans absorbed a record-breaking amount of heat — equivalent to 12 Hiroshima bombs exploding every second
summary: In 2025, the ocean absorbed an extra 23 zettajoules of heat energy in 2025, breaking the ocean heat content record for the ninth consecutive year.

title: James Webb telescope reveals sharpest-ever look at the edge of a black hole — and it could solve a major galactic mystery
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope snapped its sharpest image of the area around a black hole, solving a long-standing galactic mystery.

title: Astronomers confirm earliest Milky Way-like galaxy in the universe, just 2 billion years after the Big Bang
summary: Astronomers have confirmed the earliest barred spiral galaxy in the universe, a Milky-Way-like structure that existed just 2 billion years after the Big Bang.

title: How the ancient Romans managed their wealth (it wasn't just by hiding hoards)
summary: How did Romans invest their wealth in ancient times?

title: NASA launches Pandora telescope, taking JWST's search for habitable worlds to a new level
summary: The James Webb telescope's search for habitable exoplanets is getting a big boost from its new star-watching companion, Pandora.

title: Strange 'missing link' star system 'fundamentally changes' our understanding of planet formation
summary: A decade of observations of four planets around the young planetary system V1298 Tau revealed a rare, long-sought missing link in planet formation.

title: Romans regularly soaked in filthy, lead-contaminated bath water, Pompeii study finds
summary: A study of limescale buildup in an early bathing facility at Pompeii has revealed that the water was replaced only once per day.

title: Gender ambiguity was a tool of power 4,500 years ago in Mesopotamia
summary: Gender-ambiguous people in ancient Mesopotamia were powerful and important members of society more than four millennia ago.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.
